TITLE: Biden's other gas price quagmire
SUMMARY: Natural gas prices have tripled since January, adding more fuel to the inflation plaguing the White House's popularity.

TITLE: House Democrats press DOJ to probe Trump Interior secretary for permit reversal
SUMMARY: Lawmakers allege that David Bernhardt pressured career staff at the Fish and Wildlife Service to reverse their denial of a water permit requested by a Trump donor.

TITLE: Biden administration reverses Trump-era rule limiting scrutiny of environmental impacts
SUMMARY: The rule will allow agencies to expand consideration of environmental justice factors in decision-making.

TITLE: New Mexico’s Democrats offer an energy lesson for the party
SUMMARY: The state has tripled its renewable energy since 2019, and it’s aiming to keep that momentum — but not at the expense of its prolific oil and gas fields.

TITLE: ‘Rights of nature’ law clinic faces transphobia allegations
SUMMARY: Three people who've quit the nonprofit Community Environmental Legal Defense Fund say the group resisted efforts to make it more inclusive for LGBTQ people.

TITLE: Greens fret over Biden's latest moves to ease gasoline supply
SUMMARY: The White House is preoccupied with taming inflation and keeping the pressure on Russian President Vladimir Putin to end his war in Ukraine.

TITLE: EPA moves to ban asbestos after decades of failures

TITLE: 'Swallowing a toad': Progressives warm to Manchin's fossil fuel demands to clinch climate package
SUMMARY: Voters' frustration with high energy prices and the likelihood that Democrats will lose control of the House in November have made progressives more open to a deal.

TITLE: Biden faces a 'crisis with prices at the pump,' but no easy answers

TITLE: Biden to tap oil reserves, press oil sector to hike production
SUMMARY: While U.S. oil production has climbed since Biden entered the White House, the rate of growth has not been as quick as energy experts typically project when crude prices top $100 a barrel.

TITLE: Biden eyes using wartime powers for minerals needed in clean energy push
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden would use the Defense Production Act to help secure U.S. sources of critical minerals that are deemed key components of clean energy technology.

TITLE: Granholm: Fighting energy supply disruptions and climate change is 'not a binary choice'
SUMMARY: Instead, she told an audience at the International Energy Agency’s ministerial meeting in Paris that “both crises need addressing now.”

TITLE: U.S., EU pledge to seek new natural gas supplies to displace Russia
SUMMARY: EU countries have been scrambling to source new supplies of LNG to replace gas shipments from Russia.

SUMMARY: Details will be important, as experts have warned that the U.S. government doesn’t have the power to unilaterally command the private markets.

TITLE: Biden wants to spend infrastructure billions on climate and equity initiatives. But it’s not his call.
SUMMARY: Biden’s inability to control how a large portion of the infrastructure money gets spent is largely due to legal constraints.

SUMMARY: Biden administration officials and Republicans are using old talking points on energy. Here's why it matters.

SUMMARY: Democrats are looking into the industry's unused leases on public lands and asking why pump prices aren't dropping like crude oil, but Republicans say Biden is at fault.

TITLE: Appeals court revives key climate measure rejected by Trump judge

TITLE: Can you believe the price of gas? States move quickly to help drivers
SUMMARY: Red and blue states alike are rushing to respond to soaring gas prices.
